definition: copper (pure copper, as opposed to alloy)
copper (chemistry)/see also 紅銅|红铜[hong2 tong2]/CL:塊|块[kuai4]

sentences.english: Her hair shone copper in the sunlight.
sentences.chinese: 她的頭髮在陽光下閃着紫銅色。

sentences.english: The cloud-mussed sky turned a vague copper color.
sentences.chinese: 堆滿烏雲的天空現出一種混沌的紫銅色。

sentences.english: The relative increment of microhardness with the substrate of red copper is the biggest.
sentences.chinese: 在紫銅基體上，顯微硬度的相對增量最大。

sentences.english: Yet another school of young Rose Golds. Note the strong purplish and copper tones on their scales.
sentences.chinese: 看另外一羣兩歲大玫瑰金的紫銅底鱗片。

sentences.english: American speech soon changed the words copper bolts into brass tacks .
sentences.chinese: 美國人說馬上將這些紫銅釘改爲黃銅釘。

sentences.english: A bright pickling and chromating process for copper pipes was introduced.
sentences.chinese: 介紹了一種紫銅管光亮酸洗鈍化工藝。

sentences.english: This paper discusses the source of heat for spot welding and the theory of diffusion welding of brass and red copper.
sentences.chinese: 探討了點焊熱量的來源和黃銅與紫銅的擴散焊機理。

definition: case for an ink stone or ink slab
to sinter/to agglomerate ore by burning
to polish a text/rhetoric/ornate language/to use florid language to conceal errors/to gloss over
small cup for adding water to an ink stone
high-quality ink stonemade in Duanxi and Guangdong
